0, No tobacco use| 1, Current Tobacco user| 2, Former Tobacco User| 98, Don't Know | 99, Prefer not to answer

Field Label: Which timepoint does this clinical sample pertain to?
Field Note: Each participant is followed for up to 12 timepoints with one week in between each timepoint. Each timepoint corresponds to a specific smell card. There are 6 unique smell cards labeled as A-F. Each participant competes A-F in order and then repeats the cycle A-F so that each card is tested twice for a complete follow up.

Field Label: Unique name or identifier for biosensor protocol
Abbreviation or short label for technology
URL of publication, preprint, or website that describes technology
Type of signal generated by the methods or assay
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: amperometric | chemiluminescent | chromatographic | colorimetric | displacement | fluorogenic | gas-chromatograpic | impedimetric | MS chromatogram | olfactory perception | Raman scattering intensity | voltammetric

Field Label: Name of the quantity or quantities being measured by the technology
Value of the particular technology protocol.
Field Note: The assay readout corresponds to a participant's performance on a given component of the smell test.

Field Label: Name of unique odorants that are utilized for the given tecnology protocol
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: Grape|Smoke|Soap | Dirt|Menthol|Peach | Pineapple|Bubblegum|Clove | Strawberry|Leather|Banana | Lilac|Lemon|Chocolate | Rose|Coffee|Orange
Field Note: Each card in the olfactory battery uses exactly 3 unique odors. The participant is asked to rate the intensity of the 3 odors, identify the 3 odors, and then discriminate between pairs of the 3 odors.

Field Label: The minimum or 'worst' possible performance for the given technology
Field Note: Each technology has a lower bound and upper bound on how the participant can score. For example, the intensity of any given odor can be rated between 0 (nothing perceived) to 10 (strongest odor imaginable) and thus the min of the average across 3 odors is 0 and the max is 10.

Field Label: The maximum or 'best' possible performance for the given technology
